New Records: The Yankees clinched their 32nd consecutive winning season, matching the second-longest streak in Major League history behind the 1926-64 Yankees.
Key Match Events: The game was a shutout, with the Yankees holding the Cubs to four hits in total.
Clarke Schmidt returned from a right lat strain to pitch scoreless, and Nestor Cortes held Chicago hitless in relief.
Christian Bethancourt threw out two runners attempting to steal second base, including Nico Hoerner and Pete Crow-Armstrong.
Aaron Judge scored on a groundout in the first inning and a double steal in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Aaron Boone emphasized the strength and depth of the Yankees' rotation, noting that the team 'has a lot of talented guys on this staff and a lot of depth, which is really good.'
Post-Match Reflections: Clarke Schmidt expressed pride in the team's performance, highlighting the pitching staff's execution and the young catcher Austin Wells' contributions.
Nestor Cortes discussed his role as a reliever, stating he 'was initially irked' but accepted the challenge, showing professionalism with a strong performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' win extended their consecutive shutouts, marking their first series victory since August 23-25.
The victory also clinched their 32nd straight winning season, matching the second-longest streak in MLB history.
